CrPC 154.title: Information in cognizable cases
CrPC 154.summary: Every information relating to a cognizable offence shall be recorded by the police and a copy shall be given to the informant.
steps: Explain the incident clearly with time and location.
Insist on filing an FIR under CrPC 154.
Ask for a free copy of the FIR.

CrPC 41.title: When police may arrest without warrant
CrPC 41.summary: A police officer may arrest a person without warrant if the officer believes a cognizable offence has been committed.
steps: Check if arrest is justified and falls under cognizable offence.
You can ask for reason and arrest memo.

CrPC 91.title: Summons to produce document or other thing
CrPC 91.summary: A court or officer may summon any person to produce documents or evidence required for investigation or trial.
steps: Respond to the summon with required documents.
Consult a lawyer if unsure about the document.

CrPC 125.title: Order for maintenance of wives, children and parents
CrPC 125.summary: A person with sufficient means is bound to maintain his wife, minor children, or aged parents if they cannot support themselves.
steps: File a petition under CrPC 125 in Magistrateâ€™s court.
Submit income proof and need for support.

CrPC 200.title: Examination of complainant
CrPC 200.summary: A Magistrate takes cognizance of an offence and examines the complainant and witnesses before issuing summons.
steps: Submit written complaint to the Magistrate.
Ensure clear facts and witness details.
Wait for summons to be issued.
